Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyMonsoon
Reviews.Content: Right on the grand canal and within spitting distance of st marks square and Harry's bar, u could not get a better location to stay in Venice. Lovely terrace bar and restuarant with great views. Very nice breakfast and good atmosphere in the bar. Room on the small side and we had upgraded and asked for a canal view. We were disappointed not to get one. Overall lovely hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Location in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Cabots
Reviews.Content: The location is practically unbeatable for the price. There is a Gondolier stop right on the patio, practically. The terrace is ON the grand Canal. This is where we ate breakfast each day..and I was back in Venice a week later and took my husband there to eat late lunch..the view is SO great. I wanted him to see where I stayed on my earlier visit. You walk out the hotel door, take a left and then a right, and you are in Piazza San Marco! Harry's Bar is an overpriced 'institution' across the street, which is packed each night. My room was on the 3rd floor. There was some kitchen noise from breakfast each morning, as I had my window open. The mini fridge is in the closet..and created a lot of heat, so I found my room warm. The bed was pretty hard..but I found that to be the case in almost every place I stayed in Italy. The bathroom was massive! Huge tub, nice sink, big mirror and heated towel rack. I actually think the bathroom was bigger than the part of the room that had the bed, TV, and desk! Breakfast is a great experience.. buffet style. Eggs, pastries, meats, fruit and yogurt. You may eat on the terrace or inside. It is so amazing to eat breakfast on the grand Canal. Location is the key to this Hotel...it is nice, and close to the Piazza, so if that is what you are looking for, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK but location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Tinaluis5
Reviews.Content: First off, the location of this hotel is fantastic. San Marco is practically at the doorstep as are all the high-end boutiques like Prada, Bottega, etc. The vaporetto stop is also at your doorstep. We arrived by water taxi from the airport and literally disembarked onto the hotel patio, at which you can take breakfast. The rest of the hotel, however, is just OK only...nothing fantastic. The standard room was a comfortable enough size, and the bathroom was nice and spacious. However I didn't like that the room was carpeted, and the carpet looked and felt like it had not been cleaned in a long long time! It felt grimy under my feet and the hotel didn't provide any bedroom slippers, so that was pretty gross. I also didn't like that they have no irons and ironing boards in the rooms - you need to pay to have your clothes pressed. So business travelers, take note. The service was mixed - some really friendly and responsive staff, but also some indifferent ones. Asked the concierge to recommend a nice restaurant for dinner. He made a reservation at one, and gave us directions. When we arrived, the restaurant looked like a real tourist trap and the proprietor insisted on seating us at a stuffy corner far inside when all the al fresco tables were still unoccupied (we were really early for dinner!). It being the height of summer, we declined and decided to go to another restaurant just around the corner - far friendlier service and had a nice buzzy crowd, and we got a table outside so we could watch Venice go by. So I wouldn't recommend relying on the hotel concierge for dining recommendations - do your own research on good places to eat, and get the guy at the concierge to make reservations for you, but NOT recommend you a restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: jane_hayes
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4 night stay at this lovely hotel, a former palace recently refurbished cleverly combining both traditional and contemporary styles. It is conveniently close to the Vaporetta (waterbus) stop at Piazza San Marco. Breakfast on the terrace was a delight with a wonderful view across the Grand Canal and gondolas. The room was very clean, comfortable and had a well appointed bathroom. The Staff were efficient and polite. This hotel is in close proximity to everything you wish to be close to!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneMcc1965
Reviews.Content: My husband &i have just had a fantastic 4 day trip with my parents staying here. The staff were very attentive and helpful. We had lovely rooms on 3rd floor, we didn't have much of a view but breakfast on the terrace in the sunshine every morning more than made up for that. We booked a B&B package and breakfast was meant to be continental, but we couldn't have asked for more! We helped ourselves to anything from pastries & fruit to eggs & bacon finishing with a glass of fizz!! The location of the hotel is great, right next to Harry's bar. So you are in easy reach of St Mark's square as well as vaporetto stops there. We could not fault the experience, a wonderful trip

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: We booked a Standard double room at the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal for our 1st Wedding Anniversary. When we arrived we were informed that there had been a mix up with the booking and although we couldn't stay in the Monaco itself, we were moved to the Annexe of the Hotel Palazzo Selvadego - to a Junior Suite for 2 nights, we were also given a Complimentary meal and drinks at the hotel Monaco that evening. For our 3rd night, we were to pack our things and they would be taken across to the Monaco where we would again be given a better room than the original one booked. We were given the best room in the Hotel 329 - stunning views of the Grand Canal and the room itself was perfect. The bathroom had a bath and a separate shower, his & hers basins, toilet and bidet. We ate in the hotel restaurant twice, the food was absolutely gorgeous. The Staff were friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We went to Harry's Bar and like someone previously mentioned, the Staff there didn't seem to want us to be there, it interfered with their setting up for dinner guests. A Gondola ride is a must and thoroughly worth the 80 Euro's Having said how good it all was, I think 2/3 days in Venice is enough, you can easily walk all around the Island visiting many different parts and although there are plenty of tourists, Venice retains its natural charm.

Reviews.Title: “Never been disappointed â€“ Great Location & service”
Reviews.Author: Inxent
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal Terrace Resturant by accident as we were have a drink in Harryâ€™s Bar and they were having a bad dayâ€™s attitude problem so we decided to take our business elsewhere. We saw the terrace and decided to stop and have a drink. My wife recons it was the best Bellini she ever had so we stayed for lunch. For us the rest is history as that was February (Carnival week) 1988, and we have been back several times and also stayed in the hotel. I emailed the hotel to reserve a table on the waterfront as I was on a cruise and explained that I have been coming to the Resturant for several years and was reserved my usual table on the water edge. Whilst having an apÃ©ritif, the Maitre dâ€™ introduced himself and said have you really been coming here since 1988? I confirmed and he replied â€œ I probably served you that dayâ€� For us the service and food is superb and have never been disappointed. The entire menu is mouth-watering and the setting is absolutely delightful. Venice is not a cheap destination but the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal Terrace Resturant is great value. My advice is book and come early as within twenty minutes the Resturant is full. The staff are charming and what a beautiful location inside and outside. Never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Julia C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012. It was our fifth stay in Venice and our son and his wife came: it was their first. The rooms are very comfortable, spotless with clean sheets and towels daily. We loved having breakfast on the terrace watching Venice wake up and all the activities on the Grand Canal. The weather was perfect. The food was top quality with all you could wish for a hearty breakfast, and plenty of hot tea or coffee. My only regret was that ordering drinks, i.e.tea or coffee, on the terrace in the afternoon was so expensive, even for Venice. The staff were very helpful and friendly and allowed us to practise our Italian. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel Again and Again”
Reviews.Author: VangeInternational
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not be everyone's cup of tea especially if your used to large modern conglomerate chain Hotels, this is not that. This is Venice, I'd been here before and I will come here again, one does have to communicate ones desire for a grand canal veiw room multiple times, use a translating web site and send it a few times in English and Italian, then it has always worked for me. This Hotel has Venice and Italian charm, the staff are matter of factly, but you just have to work around the pretentious nonsense and have fun, and make jokes then you get a smile. The rooms are not large but the location to a main ferry stop and St Marks Square make it all worth while, within minutes your having coffee in a mirriade of cafes or in the Doges. Really it's all very so Venice, you'll look past the lack of modern 5 star Chain Hotels. Get into the ambience of the period, the art, the lack of cars and if your very clever you'll be transported to a Venice of yesteryear, I always read a Death in Venice whilst here I find it makes me Melancoli just enough to ignore the tourists, see past the modern signage and see the fantastic architecture, the beauty of the facades and the statues that have stood the time for over 700 years, this is when you realise that your in the heart of it in this hotel. Breakfast is served on the terrace, which is absolutely amazing to have a bite to eat by the canal in peace as your right on the Grand Canal so away from the busy tourist walkways you sit and watch the gondolas and water traffic it is all really exciting. The restaurant does dinner and lunch but it's not good value, it wouldn't be fair to say expensive, as its all relative, but if your prepared to spend this sort of money on meals then there's some really nice restaurants all in walking distance.if your in love and traveling with a loved one then eat once at the hotel at least for the service, and experience. Very easy to get to from airport by water taxi right to the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Avalon880
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights during the Carnival. The location is brilliant within easy walking distance of the Water Bus stop and St Mark's Square. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We had a problem with the shower head and the guy was in the room fixing it within minutes. Lunch on the terrace in the sunshine watching the Gondoliers coming and going was a fabulous way to spend my birthday. The room was a little cozy but with a nice bathroom. Would stay again if we come back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yc3
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome at the hotel and we couldn't ask for a better location. The hotel is next to Marks Square and in the middle of all the shopping anyone can bare. The room was very simple but that was to be expected since it looks exactly as portrayed on their website. We had all the comforts necessary to make it a great experience and the bathroom had a wonderful roman tub which was a very pleasant surprise. The only complaint I have was that the mattress was a bit hard but this was simply overlooked when you take into consideration the logistics of moving furniture in Venice. The service at the restaurant was second to none and the food was amazingly delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Principissimo
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot because of business and because of leisure but i've never had the problem I had at the Monaco. At the check out I asked them to invoice the room to the company: they said it was impossible cause they already billed the room to me as a person. I pointed out that this was a big problem for me cause, without invoice, I would have to pay the room by myself even if I was there for business. They said no again. This is crazy and I'll never go back again. If you go to venice for business stay away from the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Glen H
Reviews.Content: To be honest, we were impressed with the Hotel when we arrived. We even found a complementary bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. I thought the room was ok, livable for the few days, but my partner thought it was very small. I would agree with my partner that the view was not great...right outside the window was a concrete wall with no view of the grand canal (that we requested upon booking). Breakfast was served on the terrace, which was absolutely amazing to have a bite to eat by the canal in relative peace from the very busy tourist beaten tracks. However, the breakfasts were disappointing, and rather limited in comparison to the description of a buffet at the time of booking. We got the impression the we were frowned upon when we asked for a little extra. We never ate dinner there simply because it was fantastically over priced. To be slightly frank, I wasn't impressed by Venice. I hated the floods and floods of crowds. When we did eat out in the tourists traps we were greeted by rude waiters and an extremely poor service on each occasion (but we continued to eat out because you have to, your on holiday). 1 day of walking around the main Venice island would allow you to see all it has to offer, so please keep that in mind. I have only four bits of advice. (1) BE CAREFUL OF THE SEATING CHARGE AND THE SERVICE CHARGE, ADDS UP TO ABOUT 10 EURO BEFORE YOU EVEN BEGIN, ESPECIALLY IF THE SEATING CHARGE IS PER PERSON (PP)- (2) Go to the supermarket for food (3) take the food and find a lovely quiet spot away from the main tourist trap, we headed to an area to the east, about a 20 minute walk and had our lunches by the sea, Gardinia (I think) (4) get off the main venice island...take a boat bus to Lido, enjoy the peace and quiet and the warm hospitality in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting New Years Celebration and Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel922
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel over 10 years ago, and the location cannot be beat. I returned to celebrate New Years Eve (La Festa di San Silvestro) with my family and I can honestly say it was the best vacation I have ever had. Not only is Venice wonderful, but the hotel is fantastic. I felt the need to write this review because I saw some poor reviews and this hotel deserves 5 stars for service, and hospitality. I am very well traveled and have stayed in only the best 5 star hotels throughout Europe. I found The Monaco and Grand Canal to be so welcoming as if I were staying in someone's home. The location on the Grand Canal is better than any other of the hotels because it is not as touristy (where some of the 5 star hotels are located) yet steps away from the center of Venice, San Marco. The restaurant on the water is wonderful. I have stayed at Cipriani, the Bauer, and the Danielli and found this hotel to be so authentic and intimate where everyone knew who was a guest. The New Years Eve Gala was unforgettable. I am from Manhattan and not easily impressed, but this event was top notch. I will never forget my stay. In the end, the people, hospitality, and sights outside your door remain much longer than the color of the carpet or size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogsbythesea
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right on the water, just off Piazza San Marco. Our room was very nice, though a little small; comfortable and clean, very quiet. The breakfast was nice and served in the restaurant with a nice view. The staff was friendly and helpful. The main water taxi dock is right outside and so are the Gondola's. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE!!!!!!!COSTLY AND NOT WORTH IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flye
Reviews.Content: Don't go!!! When we arrived the service and attitude was terrible!!! You pay hundreds of USD for hotel rooms and they still want to charge you WiFI!!! Go next door to the Bauer Much Better!!!

Reviews.Title: “awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauren p
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived from the water taxi, no one was there to help with our bags and although it is a short distance to the hotel, after flying all day we were exhausted it would have been nice to have some help. I booked online and was not aware that I had a single bed room .They charged us an additional $400.00 for my mom to stay in the room and did not increase the size of the bed! the air condition did not work, and the room was the size of a small closet. The staff could care less about our comfort. The only thing good about this hotel is the location. I wish I would have done more research. It was a awful start to our vacation. very expensive and not worth it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: MoscowPavel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a heart of Venice We stayed in this hotel 3 nights in August 10. We took a water taxi - really recomended. Worth to spend 100 euros - we've been excited during all trip from airport. The location is absolutely perfect. Hotel has it's own pier - easy private access to the reception and rooms. we had a deluxe room with partial view to Grand Canal. The room was spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was exceptional - big enough, light and with all amenities. We didn't find the room noisy because we didn't open the window. But seems to if to open it would be not so good. Hotel has a superb restaurant. Breakfast was exceptional - selection of food, service and view. One evening we had a dinner too - expensive, but absolutely worth! Quality of food, service was excellent. To be honest - I always left Tips, but only after. I would not say I paid extra for getting an extra service. I would say I paid a bit more for an excellent service I had. We had 2 good advises from consierge about places for dinner. In Venice we expected to have a fine dinning in a local style and we got what we looked for. We had a complimentary private boat trip to Murano island with watching a authentic glass production. Normally it's a kind of shoping tour, but no obligations. Anyway we bought a nice vase and after we had a wonderful lunch with a local guide.The selection of Murano products was really huge - you can find things for 10,000 and up. Regarding the value - I'd not agree with some reviewers - Venice is one of the most expensive place may be worldwide. Although this hotel is not overpriced. We'd highly recomend this hotel for all travellers who value the quality and amenities but not ready to pay top price.

Reviews.Title: “A bad start - but it worked out well in the end....”
Reviews.Author: Markie_Mark115
Reviews.Content: This hotel started out by annoying me (and they heard about it...) but to be fair to them, they recovered.... Everything in Venice is hugely expensive. This hotel is no exception and I was prepared for that. I booked a deluxe room with a grand canal view. We arrived by train and I knew that the private water taxi would cost about E100 so that was no problem. The ride down the grand canal was worth it. The water taxi pulled up (the hotel has a private jetty thingy) and a uniformed bell boy was right there to take our luggage and helped us off the boat. The reception is nice. I walked up to the big desk. There was a guy behind it, so I told him my name. He looked at me like I was an idiot.... He then told me that he was the concierge and reception was the other end of the desk (where there was no receptionist...). Apparently, there is an invisible barrier there and they can't do anything to help.... Somewhat nonplussed, I took two steps to my right and waited. The concierge (?) went right back to tapping on his computer, head down. After waiting about a minute I got angry. I loudly asked the concierge where the receptionist was and told him to go and fetch him. The receptionist appeared and I think was a bit confused as my anger. Surly and unhelpful....concierge - and I am paying E750 per night for the room... I don't think so!!!! To be fair to the hotel, all the other staff are friendly and helpful - it just seems to be this one concierge guy who is an idiot. The next time I needed something, there two people at the desk so I just purposefully went to the other person. The hotel is in a prime location, the view of the grand canal was great, and I never saw the idiot after the first day... so it all worked out well. I would recommend the hotel, but it is expensive - not that huge a surprise when you are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SaveyFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal for 3 nights before a cruise - excellent waterside breakfast, comfortable beds, spacious and well-apointed bathroom. convenient to St. Mark's Square and right next to a vaparetto stop. The concierge provided wonderful recommendations for dinners. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would go back. for handicapped travelers, the bathroom facilities were great. Just a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday but...”
Reviews.Author: michael r
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt a superbly positioned hotel on the edge of the Grand Canal. On arrival check in was smooth and slick and baggage taken to the room. The room - a single - was adequate. Comfortable bed and modern almost luxurious bathroom with fantastic shower. A few stains on the carpet and a view of the internal side of the hotel (other rooms, lift shaft etc) Breakfast was continental and booked prior to arrival. Comprised one glass fruit juice, jug of coffee or tea and a basket of croissants, rolls, muffins and prepacked toast - and that was it. Everything else was extra cost - boiled egg 3Euro's, fruit salad 8 Euro's - you get the picture....extra cost for extras!! Service slick , terrace seating beautiful for breakfast watching life on the Canal and the Gondoliers getting to work etc.......lovely. THE DOWN SIDE: Consierge service could be abrupt/surly. Needed to use computer while there. The computer in reception was not working and staff at hotel would not let me use theirs to check in for my return flight. When I asked where the internet cafe was i was met with exasperation. Details of internet locations given to me but i wasn't told it that it didn't open til 11am! It was 9am when I was trying to sort this out! Exasperating and unhelpful and in my opinion this experience and the high costs of food extras and drinks took the edge off my stay. You still can't beat the location though and I think the hotel know this. Go and stay by all means but be prepared for a costly time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: BrazilFamily4
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel...4* with 5* service. Staff was great, spacious and super clean room and bathroom. Breakfast at the terrace facing Grand Canal is a great way to start the day.will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, less than average hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrandMrsKhella
Reviews.Content: Ideally located adjacent to St. Mark's Square made this hotel tolerable, but other than that it was not a place that we would stay at again. Initially the hotel lobby is pleasant enough, but once we saw our rooms we were very disappointed. As a family of four we had to rent two rooms, which is very typical of most hotels in Europe, but for nearly $600 USD /room, we expected a more luxurious setting. The rooms were small, the carpet, paint, and overall interior were in great need of refurbishing, our views were less than desirable and the overall experience at the hotel was not as nice as all of the other hotels we stayed at while traveling throughout Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: NRiggs82
Reviews.Content: When staying in Venice, you just have to bite the bullet and understand that all hotels are expensive. That said, this is an amazing hotel. It is very easy to find right off of San Marco Plaza. The main building is on the Grand Canal. Our room was in another building around the corner. The room was so cool! There was a main bedroom with large bathroom and dressing area. There was a staircase leading up to another smaller room with a twin bed. Plenty of space to spread out and it was so quant and very quiet. From the front door of our hotel to San Marco was about 50 yds which makes getting home after a night of drinking in the plaza very nice. The staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and transportation/train schedules. We would stay here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venice via the Orient Express”
Reviews.Author: RamSammy09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel whilst in Venice for the second time and nothing had changed quality wise since our first visit 6 years ago. You are met off the water taxi by the staff and your luggage is taken to your room whilst you check in. The staff are friendly and efficient and no request is refused. The rooms are very clean and quiet and room service is twice a day - lots of clean towels after a long hot day. The location of the hotel is impossible to beat with all meals taken on the terrace on the Grand canal with a wonderful view of a church, with no thorough fare available for tourists to walk in front of the hotel. Harry's bar is directly opposite the hotel, convenient after sampling the Bellini (1 is just not enough!) and St Marks Square is only a short walk around the corner from the hotel (2 minutes at the most). Due to it's location this is an ideal hotel to base your stay in Venice as the water bus stop is close by and a gondola station (if the fancy takes you and money allows - but it is a wonderful experience).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing- Over priced.”
Reviews.Author: Airtraveller2011
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Monaco. The location is excellent. Unfortunately, the staff is not very friendly, we felt like they were doing us a favor by letting us stay in their hotel. This hotel kept our passports for the entire 3 night stay. We asked for them several times and they said it was their policy. We had stayed at 5 other hotels during our trip and no other hotel kept our passports until we left. The restaurant staff was extremely rude. Their bed and breakfast package is over-rated. A basket of rolls, coffee and a juice. After spending 2 weeks touring Italy, their breakfast was the weakest of all the hotels we stayed in. Our room was very well decorated, but was extremely small. I had to turn sideways to walk along the wall to get into our bed. The linens on the beds are very rough. Our room had a view of the building about 10 feet away. Not enjoyable. This Hotel is Overpriced and Overrated for the value you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff”
Reviews.Author: jezzeer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Right on the water edge. Water taxi from airport to hotel door in 20 mins. We returned on 24th July 2011. Lovely food but expensive like most of Venice main hotels. Answered any questions we had and all spoke good english. We had a grand canal view which is worth paying the extra for the views. Nice and quite at night as nobody can walk past the front of hotel and wooden shutters in addition to windows keep it peaceful. Will return again. Keep Â£200 a day if you want to have lunch and dinner. You can pick up a piece of pizza in side streets for Â£4.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & great location!”
Reviews.Author: daybee1
Reviews.Content: Breakfast on the patio over looking the canal was absolutely delightful. The staff were pleasant and the rooms were immaculate and fairly roomy. The beds were extremely comfy. The location was perfect for exploring Venice and catching a gondola ride.

Reviews.Title: “VENICE .........WHAT CAN I SAY !”
Reviews.Author: gemFC
Reviews.Content: from arriving at the airport to the time you leave it is magical. I have been to a few italian cities and one is spectecular. the ride in on the water taxi was brilliant it is just amazing to see and once there the hotel did not dissapoint a 2 min walk from where you get of the water taxi so really easy to find. when we checked in the hotel was freindly and helpful. are room was lovely everything that you needed and comftable. not much view out the window but this did not matter as you dont spend alot of time in there! the hotel had a fab location just round the corner from st marcs square and next to the famous harrys bar. all in all great hotel amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: abroughton
Reviews.Content: I had the distinct - and unexpected - pleasure of staying at the Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal last week. (I say "unexpected" because my room and my brother's room were reserved at Monaco's sister hotel, the less expensive Palazzo Selvadego, while my parents room was reserved at the Monaco.) Upon arrival at the Hotel's private dock, we were immediately greeted by a concierge and porter who assisted us into the large lobby with our considerable amount of luggae. The desk clerk greeted us cordially and then advised me that he had amended our reservation so that all three rooms were now in the Hotel Monaco. It was a wonderful surprise and really got the trip off to a great start. Additionally, although I booked a "single," my room was spacious double with an enormous bathroom. From what I could tell after visiting my parents and brother/sister-in-law's rooms - all of the bathrooms were large and well appointed. The concierge (I wish I could remember his name!) took the time to orient us to the city and point out the main sites on a map, which was very helpful. He also explained that the Hotel, in conjunction with a glass factory on Murano, offers a free water taxi to and from Murano every half hour. We took advantage of that and received and amazing trip across the lagoon and around the island to Murano. Some other reviewers found the breakfast to be inadequate, but I found it to be quite the opposite. The complimentary breakfast is served on the beautiful terrace overlooking the lagoon. We arrived to find a beautifully set table with silver coffee pots and three silver baskets brimming with croissants, sweet rolls, and muffins. There was also a selection of jellies and butter to compliment the pastries. The coffee was endless and the staff friendly. It was lovely to munch on pastries while watching the boats pass as the sun glinted off the water. I would also like to comment on prior reviews which noted that the staff was aloof or snooty. We did not find that to be the case at all. Except for one night concierge, we found the entire staff (reception, concierge, waters, housekeeping) to be efficient and friendly. All requests were addressed quickly and with a smile. The rooms were cleaned in the mornings and tidied again when the beds were turned down. As all previous reviewers have noted, the location is sensational. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and would highly recommend the Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal to anyone visiting Venice. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION makes this hotel stand out!”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: When you get off of the Vaporetto at San Marco VALLARESSO, this hotel is literally STEPS away. No climbing bridges, no far hikes...just checking in and then out to explore. Also excellent for its fabulous proximity to St. Mark's Square, this hotel is one I would frequent again. It's elegant and well-appointed. But, you can find other hotels in Venice that have that. For me, it's all about location with this one. The Grand Canal Restaurant (and separate bar with separate menu) is perfect for gondola watching or just resting after a hard day of sightseeing. All in all, a MUST if you want the ideal location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1st time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jackie-cowie8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the last weekend in February ,1st weekend of the carnival. It is a fab hotel location wise, as St Marks square is out of the door turn left and 2 mins walk.. The water taxi from the airport puts you off right out side the door so no need to drag cases around.Water bus and gondollers just outside too. The rooms are typical italian small but comfortable , could do with coffee/tea facilities as after 10pm tll 8pm you cannot get a hot drink in the hotel.. I would recommend this hotel to stay in but beware the staff are not as friendley as you would expect .... the front desk staff will ingnore you if they can and give very basic answers to your questions . Whilst there my hubby had and accident and needed a ambulance , the night concierge was very reluctant to call one and he only did so on my insistance .... when they arrived my hubby did need to be taken to the hospital ( good job i insisted ) the night concierge just looked on ..... Beware if you are taken to accident and emergency , on the night we were taken no one spoke English which made things quite difficult and when they have finished with you they put you out of the hospital and you have to find your own way home ..... very difficult at 4am ... when the only way home is to get a water taxi .. make sure you always have a contact number for a taxi or your hotel.....( it also cost us 60 euro's) Unfortunatly I had to ask for an ambulance(,as no doctor connected to hotel) again the next night as my hubby had a reaction to the previous nights accident , had same problem with night conceige , once again just looked on as hubby was taken away . The next day not one member of management asked if he was ok or offered any help ... THe free continental breakfast is ok but a second glass of juice will cost you and you do not get cereal this is an extra ...... the breakfast staff... will serve you but don't speak english so be prepaired to ask for options very clearly or you might not get what you want... Venice is a beautiful city , anyone who goes will love it I am sure but don't expect the the staff in some resturants /tourist area's to like you I think they all just tolorate tourists.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for access to all main attractions and transport”
Reviews.Author: sarahj666
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed how easy it was to find the hotel and how convenient it was just a short walk from the waterbus from the airport. The staff on arival were very pleasant and our bags were taken to the room and we did not feel a tip was actually necessary as in some hotels by the porters but we gave one anyway. The room was excellent really well decorated with a good ambience. The bathroom was beautiful and had everything you could need and a hair dryer which is always a bonus for most girls!! We also liked the fact that there was a free safe in the room which does help as it meant we did not to have walk around Venice with all our valuables. There was a mini bar which as you would expect was pretty expensive. TV showed the usual english BBC news but to be honest, if you would rather watch the tv then explore the wonders of Venice, then you are missing out. Breakfast as described by others was not at all exciting but what you come to expect from some european cities. There is an al a carte menu which you had to pay for and we did think that the small boxes of cereal and fruit should have been part of the normal breakfast also with the opportunity to get more than one small glass of juice if required. As with most Italian cities church bells are a problem and this hotel is situated so close to St Marks Square that you will not be able to avoid them. If you get a room which runs alongside the alleyway you can also here noise from people which in the summer with windows open could keep you awake. Do what we did and bring yourself some earplugs and this certainly was not a problem. The hotel is situated right on the grand canal and is perfect as it is right next to a Vaporetto stop and also gondolas and the Alilaguna which takes you to the airport. We found the public transport and attractions very reasonably priced, however the cost of food was pretty expensive. January is a great time to go if you want to avoid crowds and we managed to see so much without having to queue for anything. One thing we would point out is that many restaurants are closed until February as it appeared this was a break for most people after Christmas. We had an excellent few days and would definitely recommend the Doges Palace, a trip to Burano and just generally getting lost amongst all the streets. We hope you enjoy Venice as much as we did and we certainly would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again if we came back.

Reviews.Title: “great location; good room if does not smell!; breakfast poor”
Reviews.Author: alic2
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. The staff are very nice and efficient. unfortunately the smell of venice penetrated our first room - to the extent it woke me up through the night. However they changed our room when asked and the second room had no smell whatsoever. The breakfast could be better. Due to location and service at changing our room promptly - I would recommend - especially for first time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but be vary of the flooding”
Reviews.Author: s3rz
Reviews.Content: The location of the is hotel is great. Reception is nice, the check in was great, the staff accomodated us straight away even though we arrived much earlier than the check in time. The only negative was that the hotel had not prepared for street flooding, we needed to leave the hotel one day early around nine and we got stuck as there was water in the streets.... the water bus station was just a few steps away but we couldn't get there due to the water the streets. The least the hotel could have done is arrange for foot stools to walk on in case of flooding as was done but other hotels on the sea front. Another thing, please have free wifi, you are anyways charing alot for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Les666
Reviews.Content: It has been said before but this hotel is in the perfect location, Venice can be hard to navigate for first timers and even on my 3rd visit I was making mistakes...However being next to St Marks square this was so easy to find.. Reception is nice, lifts to all floors, hotel is quiet and if you like the sound of the people below just open a window... I was given a room also suitable for disabled people and it had a wet room for a shower..very large and clean room...Staff friendly, professional and were mainly Italian..I stay in many places and if staying in Venice again I would certainly look here first... If you need advice on how to get here from the airport just message me, its an easy journey and also easy to go wrong.. One last thing, if you go to Venice at anytime other than the Summer take some rubber boots.. being next to the waters edge the roads around the hotel flood. My only complaint is about the internet, most hotels I stay in have free Wifi, however in general no where in Venice does this plus it can be hard to get a signal or you pay for the link...the 1 computer in hotel charges 6 Euros for 15 mins..

Reviews.Title: “If location is everything, then...”
Reviews.Author: wandering-soprano
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in December 2009. I was held up in Frankfult due to the snow storm, and convincing the hotel staff not to charge me for the night I booked but spent in Frankfult was a little difficult. Very close to San Marco Varalesso and the location is ideal. Breakfast starts somewhat late, and although the atmosphere in the breakfast room is nice, the meal itself was stingy. If you value location above anything, I'd recommend this hotel. Say, if you are a single female traveler arriving late at night, this hotel may be a good choice. Marie

Reviews.Title: “Location, location..”
Reviews.Author: Jensen88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Moncao & Grand Canal for just two nights, but had a very nice stay and the location is perfect. Having an early breakfast at the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and seeing the city wake up is a special treat. I furthermore found the service very good and the decor very tasteful. I hope to be back one day for a bit longer stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great location trumps minor complaints!”
Reviews.Author: aurorio
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all, the location is truly outstanding. I took a water taxi from the airport and was pleased to step off the boat and walk straight into the lobby. Most of the staff was very friendly, although I was a bit disappointed that they take the check in time very seriously, so I was not able to check in about an hour early. Oh well. The room was pretty nice. Good a/c, huge well-appointed bathroom, comfy bed (my "double" was actually two twins put together, each with their own bedding, which was a little odd), and nice mini bar! The room I booked was not listed as a canal view, as I found those to be super expensive, but it nonetheless looked out on the canal, though the windows had canopies. I still had great views and that was one of the best things about the room. My issues were pretty minor: no alarm clock (or clock of any kind), no wifi or cable for the wired internet, and a yummy but overly expensive breakfast. The location is fantastic and if you want a comfy bed (or two!) in a pleasant spot with easy access to the rest of venice, this is a good option. just bring an alarm clock!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality service, bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: artist2be
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this hotel and was fairly confident that we would have a good experience. I stayed in Venice a week before and was very happy with my hotel. However, the check in was miserable. The woman at the front desk was rude bordering on surly. I put my address on the wrong line and she threw the papers back down in front of me. Then there was a questionaire that required yes/no answers and required a signature. Since it was in Italian, I didn't know what I was signing and when I asked, I got a digusted look and was told to just fill in "no" then. The room we got was OK, not 4 star quality, but the carpets was really stained. My daughter didn't want to remove her shoes. I asked at the front desk if there was a better room and was told that it was the tourists who dirty the carpet and the only upgrade was a canal facing room for 300 Euros a night more. We ran out of tiolet paper and the maid servoice didn't replace it or the tissue. The continental breakfast was the worst we have had in Europe, a bowl of bread, coffee and orange juice. One morning my daughter and I ordered scambled eggs and they arrived in a small casserole dish and were half cooked, sitting in a 1/4 inch of liuid eggs...inedible. Other than location, in my opinion there are much better, more friendly hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: SusanJones30
Reviews.Content: This is a very sty;ish and elegant hotel, The public areas are impressive and an interesting mix of old and modern, The rooms we had were small but pleasant, comfortable and well equipped. Standards of cleanliness were excellent. The hotel was amazingly quiet considering its location. Staff were very helpful. The restaurant was good, though expensive. It occupies a stunning location overlooking the grand canal, and eating breakfast here is a great way to start the day. My only criticism is the standard of the included breakfast: it consisted of a variety of white breads and jam. Other things were available, but at an extra cost. The locaion is as central as you could get, and excellent for reaching the main sights of Venice. Vaporetti and water taxis stop right outside the hotel for gong further afield Be warned that the "free" trip which the hotel offers to Murano includes an unavoidable visit to the glass blowing furnace they drop you off at followed by a fairly hard sell.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VENICE HOTEL FOR LOCATION AND BANG FOR YOUR BUCK”
Reviews.Author: rlgm007
Reviews.Content: Just a stone's throw from Piazza San Marco, minutes away from the San Marco Alilaguna water bus (lineas blu, rosso, and oro to/from Marco Polo airport), and next door to Harry's Bar, sits the incomparable Monaco and Grand Canal. Built on the grand canal, you enter through an elegant doorway off the Calle Vallaresso into a 17th century palazzo and it's now modern glass covered colonnaded atrium to find the black tiled receptionist desk encased in glass. The hotel offers rooms in 3 different areas (recently remodeled rooms, the regular rooms and rooms in a nearby location). The price includes continental breakfast at the terrace restaurant overlooking the grand canal and the Punto Della Dogama museum (a must see) across the canal - a spectacular place to eat. You may order other breakfast items or ask for breakfast in bed at an additional charge. I stayed in an older room on the 3rd floor with a spot-lighted wood beam ceiling rising to about 12 feet. The room shows a few signs of expected wear and tear but overall for the price, room size, comfort, room amenities, large bathroom and cleanliness, you won't find a better room in Venice. Although not overly friendly, the entire staff promptly attended to my every request and need in a very professional manner. The concierge went out of his way to show me how to get to various points of interest throughout the city. My only minor complaint or rather suggestion to the hotel management is to relocate and modernize the hotel bar. The present bar tucked away to the side, appears dated, too small and secluded, and unappealing to enjoy a 15 euro ($18 US) cocktail. It should be hip with modern decor that matches the lobby and plays lounge music. I'd put it either in the area next to the atrium (with the door opening up to the side canal, leaving the door always open, or in the hallway leading up to the grand ballroom). I highly recommend the Metropole Hotel's bar for the vibe, ambiance and great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ICEÂ·BC
Reviews.Content: the Monaco and Grande Canal is a very nice hotel, better than I honestly expected. We were on the 4th floor near the front of the hotel and had a large and unexpected balcony, the staff were efficient and pleasant. Careful where you eat out as it can be extortionate, we averaged 100 to 140 euro for a 2 course meal and a glass of wine for 2 adults, not as expensive as I'd been lead to believe but not cheap. Get out nice and early as it get busy around 9am with all the tour boat pasengers and also get a day ticket for the water bus 16 euro a head for 12 hours and dot around on them, if you get on them around 7 am you should get a seat at the open end back to take photos. we were there over a saturday and sunday when it seemed not so busy Lots of places to get a reasonable snack lunch (20 odd euro) ...note hotels often offer a "free" trip to the morano island glass factory so dont waste money booking it in advance. we didnt do either but did do the vaporeta(waterbus) round the island. Go here with an open mind, expect it to be a bit expensive and if its not, its a bonus, just enjoy yourself. The only negative was the Venitians themselves were not that friendly and only seemed intrested in your money.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Venice perfect”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: I asked my 16 year old to find a hotel in Venice. She chose this one and told me this was the best one in Venice. I originally booked a double exclusive room and a double room with a canal view. We called the day before to confirm if they are connected and the lady on the phone said they are not. When we arrived, we had a double room connecting with a triple room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. The person on the phone must have read my mind. Because of the fireworks on July 17 for the Feast of the Redeemer, this was perfect and we watched the fireworks which were directly in front of our room. The location of this hotel is perfect - shopping begins right outside the back door; gondola rides right out in front; St. Mark's a step away. The bathrooms were heavenly and they came to change the towels twice a day. The air condition was perfect and we didn't hear anything at night even though we were right on the grand canal. The beds were so comfortable and we had tv in the living room and the bedroom. The lobby was inviting to sit and we had breakfast every morning at the terrace restaurant overlooking the canal. We ordered room service a couple of times and it was great. Venice is hot in the summer and this hotel really is the best for venice at this time of year. The prices of this hotel were much less than some of the other higher range hotels, but their service was of the highest. Thanks so much, Hotel Monaco. We walked to Rialto in the mornings for their fish and vegetable market. We also took the hotel's free ride to Murano glass factories and really had our own private boat because nobody came with us. Our stay in Venice was absolutely magical because of you!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LittleTLondon
Reviews.Content: We took a water taxi from the airport directly to the hotel terrace, what a lovely way to travel, where we had lunch before checking into our rooms.The service was very good. The view from the terrace is wonderful and lovely to watch the world go by. Breakfast is also served here so a nice way to start your day. The location of the hotel is very good, just off St. Marks Square. We had some lovely meals in Venice, our best by far being on the island of Burano, at Trattoria Al Gatto Nero. Our room was a standard room which was as expected, the bathroom was very nicely furnished and it was kept spotless. We loved Venice and I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, amazing views, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Huggybears
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious with plenty of storage room for clothes etc. The bed was HUGE! The bathroom was large and very tastefully decorated in typical Italian style. Complimentary bottle of wine was also personally delivered to our room and much appreciated. Air conditioning fully adjustable. The hotel is close to St Marks Square and also the various water bus services etc. The external part of the restaurant overlooks the Grand Canal providing wonderful views. Overall, as a package which included breakfast, this hotel receives full marks in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “JUST FANTASTIC !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CooldudesRus
Reviews.Content: You must get a water taxi for 100 euros from the airport, no need to book pay on arrival at airport, then a 4 min walk to water taxi, fast and fantastic way to start our romantic 1st anniversary break,water taxi takes you to the hotels door,and you step off the taxi in full view of everyone eating and drinking on the restaurant terrace, which makes you feel like royalty!!! On arrival Hotel is very impressive,location is perfect walking 2 mins to st marks square,breakfast on the terrace canal overlooking the Gondolas was just fab fab fab, tea/coffee, fresh juice, croissants pastries jams, and you could have a full english if you wanted to pay extra,you must try pistachio or melon ice cream as this was the best ice cream we have had in a long time at 1 euro a scoop,to eat and drink on a budget then we would advise to stay clear of st marks square, 8 euros for a small bottle of coke,instead go to the backstreet cafes, very close but so much cheaper,Overall we had a fantastic short break, Also came back engaged after being proposed to in st marks square,Very romantic,Great place to propose

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit, even only just to eat”
Reviews.Author: Stuartstead
Reviews.Content: When i saw the website for the hotel i wondered if it would be as good as it was making out it was. Don't worry, you cannot describe the feeling you get when you turn up on the terrace on a river taxi, its like making your grand entrance to dinner by turning up in the middle of the restaurant, possibly right at your table, by boat. Rooms and the overall standard and fittings for the hotel are good. Lots of luxuries you would expect for a price like this. Best overall, you have to eat there! Even if just spending day in town, or staying in another hotel and looking for somewhere good, book a table for lunch or dinner and you will not be let down. The food is top notch and the waiters treat you like kings. I am terrible for names, always have been, but head waiter (assume this would be his title) is 5 star on his own. He took personal delight in your stay being good and recommendations can be followed without question for our next visit. Made a good hotel a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Woodski909
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in june 2010.Get the water taxi from Marco Polo for 100 Euros to the hotel it was ace .Drop off right at the door to the hotel was so convenient.The hotelis top quality in the best position in Venice.Hotel staff are very friendly and breakfeast by the water is really the way to start your day.If you can be the early bird and get on the go pre 7.00 am you will see a very uncluttered Venice.Food and drink at the Hotel are expensive.Many restaurants are doing deals so watch out for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Two_Irish_Bears
Reviews.Content: Cant fault the hotel. Got an upgrade from their sister hotel. Front desk on check were great. The room was very nice and clean but small like most Venetian rooms. Breakfast on the deck was class. It's right beside the boat stop San Marco and Harry's bar. No complaints. May is a good time to go. Must see is the Doge's palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: jojobLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel many years ago in a completely different context and had enjoyed it enormously so I anticipated a similarly positive experience 15 years later. The situation of course remains the same and is perfect. The terrace over the grand canal is a wonderful place to eat or drink and watch the world go by, and the staff here are just great. Food is also some of the best we experienced in Venice. Reception has been tarted up since my last visit and looks good. However my room was disappointing: small and dark with a view of a wall only a couple of metrres away; pounding music coming through the walls from somewhere not very far away; tired furniture and bathroom; hard small bed with worn sheets. Oh and at check out, despite giving them an hour's warning that I was leaving I had to wait 15 minutes while they put together the bill. So in summary a mixed experience. If I had been paying the bill myself I would have felt very short changed.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ksm100
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 night stay here. Excellent location on the Gran Canal near to the vaparetto and alilaguna stops, with it's own water taxi landing. Standard room was an adequate size and simply furnished, with a lovely marble bathroom and good over-bath shower. We were given a twin room rather than a double, and on complaining to the fron desk they said they would push the beds together rather than give us another room - very disappointing, and not at all romantic! Otherwise we were pleased with our stay - the terrace for breakfast was wonderful, but only continental breakfast is included. We also ate in the restaurant one evening, and had drinks in the bar on a couple of evenings - service from the restaurant and bar staff was excellent. Prices were expensive, but not unexpected. My one complaint was that someone peed in out toilet while doing the evening turndown - clearly a man, as we arrived back to the room in the early evening to find the seat up and he had not flushed. Not at all pleasant! Otherwise a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location- Worth every Euro!”
Reviews.Author: Sue2010_10
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Venice, it is worth the water bus to stay in San Marco area and this is a great hotel, great location. Conceirge offers all the right suggestions and more- ask for Mario ;) - Sue & Sue

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyStarSwansea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal for three nights. Venice is a really magical place and we loved everything about it. The hotel was lovely and modern, whilst retaining some veneitian charm and elegance. The room was lovely and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal was a delightful experience that none of us will ever forget. The only negative point I would make is that the hotel bar prices were very expensive. This was a pity, since we would have loved to have enjoyed a bellini or two on the terrace in the evening. I would definitely stay here again though! Fantastico!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Goldens18
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Venice. We stayed at Hotel Monaco for three nights. The hotel is in a great location. It's a bit pricey, but it's well worth the price. Venice is an expensive city, but it's manageable. We had a room on the higher floors. You can barely hear the noise from the alley. The mattress is a little hard, but the room is pretty large for European standards. The bathroom is large, and it had a handheld shower head. A nice touch. We enjoyed our time in Vencie, and would stay at Hotel Monaco again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Helztelz
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - perfect location as very near the water bus station. Rooms a little on the small size but roomy enough for a large kingsize bed which was comfortable. Restaurant very good if a little pricey

Reviews.Title: “Absolute rubbish! Worst hotel experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: SAtraveller80
Reviews.Content: Besides the location which is excellent, this hotel was terrible. Our room had gaping holes in the wall and the "bed" was in fact two mattresses on top of two old fold-out metallic camping beds! No headboard, no bedside tables, thin floppy pillows. The heating didn't work so we were cold throughout our stay. other four star hotels in Italy will offer you a buffet breakfast, but not here. Just a couple of rolls and a flakey croissant. The member of staff at front desk whom we dealth with throughout our stay was rude and unhelpful. I was absolutely shocked by this place. Thank goodness we were only here for three nights and then moved on to lovely hotels in Florence and Rome. We have done a fair amount of travelling, and this was by far the absolute worst hotel we have stayed in anywhere in the World.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful location, but ... well, it's Venice so what do you expect really”
Reviews.Author: benyc
Reviews.Content: Best parts? > location by far. Right on the canal, steps from the water ferry/taxi, few minutes from the Piazza San Marco ... The hotel restaurant had a wonderful, menu of interesting Italian dishes with a definite Venetian perspective. Its service was very nice, too. The lobby was nice, but not as grand as one might expect. The room was far below standard expectations as it was quite shabby-looking. These last two points, though ... well, it is Venice and that's not unusual. The hotel has no spa, pool, etc ... a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great food to be had”
Reviews.Author: luke_ad_murphy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, my review is only for the restaurant as my wife and I did not stay here. We ate here on Christmas Day 2009 and had a superb meal complimented by outstanding service. We tried to choose our location for Christmas dinner carefully and were not at all disappointed by with our selection. Try the cheese mousse - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant and magical. Would love to come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: steviemcglone
Reviews.Content: I took my wife away to the Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal in Venice for two nights to celebrate her 40th birthday. Fantastic location, lovely hotel and having never been to Italy before this was breathtaking. Venice is expensive but if you do not go mad it is just about acceptable. One thing that really anoyed us though was Harrys Bar(right next door to the Hotel) The place where the Bellini was invented!!! What a rip off. We paid 15 euros to stand up in an overcrowded tiny restaurant come bar where there are more staff than customers. It has no atmosphere and we felt it was such a waste of time and money. Go of the beaten track and explore smaller friendlier cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, very smart hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: anemonerose
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times now, for both business and leisure. Originally through tour company city breaks but now booking directly with the hotel, latterly on their "romantic breaks" which are very good value with 72-hour water bus ticket included. On this last visit, we stayed in the Palazzo Salvadego (the hotel's annexe) to see how it compared to the main hotel. The Palazzo Salvadego's room size and proximity to St Mark's Square (just a few yards, and we thought the main hotel location was close!) are excellent. From this visit, though, we prefer the main hotel, mainly because breakfast can be served in your room on a beautifully-laid table/large trolley and we found the restaurant breakfast service very chaotic on 3 of the 4 mornings of our stay. On the first morning we were overlooked on arrival, then a further delay taking our "extras" orders (simple scrambled egg and boiled egg), then our orders arrived separately with a long gap between them. On the second & third mornings we gave up trying to order extra items as the service was so slow and chaotic! On our last morning, though, the weather was great and we sat on the terrace by the Grand Canal (wonderful!) and received very good service. We've always found the evening restaurant service, food and wine excellent. The hotel's seafood risotto is to die for and, when we've decided to forego the dessert course, the restaurant staff have placed a couple of "taster" desserts on the table for us to try anyway! The reception staff are very professional and the concierge staff have always been very helpful (unlike other Venice hotels we've stayed in!). Internet access in the lobby is reasonable (4 euros for 15 mins) and enabled us to check in online for our flight home. Still our favourite hotel in Venice and the location right by the water bus and airport Alilaguna stops can't be beaten, especially when arriving in the evening or having to drag heavy bags back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PDPatara
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful stay in the Hotel Monaco with my wife and two daughters (9+13) having being upgraded from the Palazzo del Selvadego. Booked the Selvadego based on tripadvisor reviews. We had two rooms, both very comfortable and found the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is unbeatable right on the grand canal and beside st marco. The highlight of the hotel is having breakfast or sitting back having a few drinks watching the world go by on the canal....wow ! Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Always wanted to stay at this hotel but there's better to be had in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: ArgyllLynn10
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights here and although the staff were friendly and attentive enough the Bauer Hotel a couple of blocks down on the canal is far better. Breakfast on the canal terrace was spoiled by the constant biz of the gondola stop and the Vaporetta. We felt we were being rushed , also although breakfast was included we were charged for cereals , mineral water etc ! Had dinner in the Metropole hotel - absolutely stunning and can't wait to stay there next time. Also go over to the Hilton Molino Stucky Hotel for a drink on the rooftop Bar- the views are great.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, super-friendly and competent service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: CJAlice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hotel Monaco and Grand Canal twice now, once on our own and a second time with our parents. Both stays were for 3-4 nights. Their "Romantic" and "Honeymoon" packages are a great deal, especially considering the level of service they provide and their generous-sized, clean, modern rooms. I'm not big on hanging out in lobbies, but I really enjoyed spending some time in their beautifully designed lobby, well-lit with natural light from the glass ceiling. Everyone at the front desk as well as with the concierge desk were extremely competent and helpful with bags, directions, arranging complementary boat rides to surrounding islands, and particularly dinner reservations. The location could not be more ideal - directly in front of the San Marco vaporetto stop and just steps from Piazza San Marco. The beds are comfortable, the in-room breakfast is good (particularly their cappuccinos), and the Grand Canal restaurant is excellent (one of the best in all of Venice) for food, service and views, not to mention Harry's Bar is just across the narrow street, convenient from Bellinis in the afternoon or hot chocolate in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value, lively contemporary style in old buidling”
Reviews.Author: Benarm
Reviews.Content: On a recent to trip to Venice for the Biennale, I found the Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal very good. Their website is confusing, but I found reservation staff very accomodating when I contacted them via email. Getting to the Biennale, the hotel was an easy 15 minute walk away along the Grand Canal. This hotel is right on the Grand Canal but has no pedestrian walkway in front of it which means you can get a water taxi to and from the airport, almost straight into the hotel. The style of the hotel is warm, contemporary and lively, and although the room I had was a good size, quiet and perfectly adequate, it was a bit plain. It was however excellent value, as I was on a 3 nights for the price of 2 offer, which included an excellent basic breakfast on the terrace. As others have commented, the restaurant on the terrace is fantastic, although very pricey. We had two lunches there and they were memorable for excellent food, service and view out over the water taxis, ferries and gondolas coming and going. Be warned, if you are going for dinner, make a reservation via the hotel and dont wear shorts or overly casual clothing at night, you may be turned away. Hotel service was generally helpful, sometimes warm but occasionally extremely gruff. This however seemed representative of service across Venice.

Reviews.Title: “uneven but good overall”
Reviews.Author: katerinasingapore
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was not what we had made a reservation for. Once we got the second room, things were much better. The shower was great! The outdoor restaurant right on the Grand Canal was definitely worth it. Beware of the "old" part of the hotel. Some of it had been renovated, other parts had not...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near St. Marks & on the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: mamabear9
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastico!!! Around the corner from St. Mark's Square. (But in Venice, it's a pleasure to walk anywhere, so enjoy that, too!) Very nice lobby and staff. The refurbished structure has a lot of character. Our room was smaller than our other hotels in Italy, but not a problem. Not plush, but nice enough. Nice bright bathroom with window. Lovely views...even if you don't get a canal view, any view of Venice is nice! We enjoyed an under-canopy, canal-side restaurant breakfast every morning...what a perfect way to begin every day in Venice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel STOLE my money”
Reviews.Author: vicnoho
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the hotel and after several exchanges via email, I was told that a reservation for my stay had not been made. I made the reservation in October for a February stay but since I was told that none existed, I forgot about it. In February, I received a call that I had not shown up and that my card would be charged; I was shocked since I didn't have anything in my calendar. After checking the email history, I disputed the charge with my credit card company and they refunded the money after agreeing with me. THE HOTEL LIED ABOUT MY GOING FOR A CONFERENCE and had my credit card reverse the charge. Needless to say, I paid the bill, canceled my card and WILL NEVER STAY HERE or recommend this place to anyone. STAY AT THE HOTEL FLORA OR BAUER GRUNWALD where they're aren't any scam artists like Anna in Reception. Obviously, the hotel is doing poorly and will do anything to take your money. I travel to Venice twice a year and this would have been my first time there. Trust me, THERE ARE BETTER PLACES TO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, couldn't fault one thing!”
Reviews.Author: Lauraef86
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned back from a 3 night trip to Venice staying at the Monaco Hotel. I can honestly say it is the nicest hotel I have been too. It really is stunning both from the outside and the inside! We had a double room with a double bed, and a gorgeous marble en suite bathroom. The room was a good size and everything was immaculate. The view we had over looked the little street next to the hotel but we experienced no noise what so ever. Breakfast was served 7am-10.30am on the beautiful terrace outside overlooking the Grand Canal, there are gondolas and water boats directly outside the hotel so theres lots to look at when your outside. Breakfast is continental, it includes croissants, muffins and jams and tea/coffee/juices. Anything extra you will be charged for and if there is one downside to the hotel it is the cost of things such as this but we just found some nice little cafe's etc to have a small bite to eat so it's not really a problem. The location of the hotel is probably one of it's best points. You walk out of the hotel and you are about 2-3 mins walk from San Marco square and all the main attractions. This is a superb hotel, wonderful staff, great location..not one negative thing to say really!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good elevator, expensive”
Reviews.Author: retiredJB
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my father, so I expected beds quite separate, but I found that they are an inch apart and I would say 3/4 full, so they probably have an insert to make them into a king. Just be prepared if you are traveling with someone you had not planned to sleep with. Elegant hotel, beautiful bathroom, right at San Marcos Square. All the water taxis and gondolas dock behind. Fascinating to watch. Really - it is all about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: juliamould
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, quite quiet. Fantastic location - convenient for everything in Venice and spectacular view from the terrace restaurant. Bedroom a little on the small side, mould in the bathroom off putting and surprised that 'bed and breakfast' meant you got a bit of dry bread and coffee and everything else was charged for

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location friendly staff great food”
Reviews.Author: jambogirl
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - right on grand canal - 5 mins from St Marks. Stop directly outside front of hotel for water taxis. Hotel has complimentary water boat for guests wishing to visit a glass blowing exhibition - recption staff happy to set up trip. We were given a free upgrade with a canal view as it was our anniversary. Also complimentry bottle of champagne with card from hotel staff. Really lovely touch Venice wonderful place with great food/drink - hotel made stay perfect with view of the canal and superb location. Public areas very plush, lots going on as huge reception rooms hosting lots of different events - adds to the atmosphere. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Vivienn
Reviews.Content: There is only one word to describe this hotel : PERFECT !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location if you can afford it or get a discount”
Reviews.Author: Getabreak
Reviews.Content: Spent a lot of time researching before we went in Feb 09, but could not have found a better location. Right next to St Marks Square pier. Walked everywhere so didnt buy boat pass. Rooms small but very adequate and well appointed. Take a travel kettle if you like tea in your room (Â£7 a cup in Harry's Bar next to hotel!) Good continental breakfast included in room price - with fantastic views from restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is our romantic city - this hotel is not”
Reviews.Author: restondrums
Reviews.Content: It's actually a business man's hotel. The staff has a certain air about them that is professional and yet...distant. Breakfast was basically Continental, a roll, coffee, yes, on a deck overlooking the Grand Canal but does that mean you can't offer what a 3-star in Venice would offer. Perhaps it was because we're American but no, we're old hands at Venice (our 16th trip, from our honeymoon to this year and yes, we will be back in 2009 but staying at the Metropole (our original honeymoon hotel). For the money, the Saturnia is also a find if you want a true Venetian experience, classic, classy. In essence, we were really turned off but that's life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: skof10
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Venice and stayed at the Monaco. Beautiful hotel in a very convenient and central location. Situated right on the Grand Canal and the water bus stop is just outside. You can also get a direct ferry to the airport from this stop. Our flight was delayed on the trip to Venice so we arrived much later than expected. Upon arrival the staff were very friendly and accommodating especially considering how late it was. The room was small but had everything you needed including an umbrella. The bathroom was lovely with a sunken bath. As mentioned in a previous review we got a great rate as it was off season. It may not seem as good value in peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it professes to be.”
Reviews.Author: Snorripigzzz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a package for a city break as it seems a perfect location for sight seeing and supposedly superior class. Yes the location was great but as for superior class... its all a facade. Asked for a room with bath but got a shower instead (although very nice shower) Maid service is a bit hit and miss, I dont think they vaccumed the floor for the whole four days we were there. Felt very inpersonal and business like, and although on first impression it looks opulent it is very uncomfortable. Only one hard chair in the bedroom which was very cramped, and the lounge bar very cold and uncomfortable, not to mention expensive! Forty five euros for two cups of tea and a toasted cheese and ham sandwhich made with cheap square ham out of a packet. As for the complimentary breakfast, a croisant and some stale bun thingy (anything else you paid a very high price for, and even then there wasn't much choice), it was a joke! the only good thing being a nice view of the canel while you ate it! They try to push the restaurant, the menu looked grand but after the breakfast and bar experience we didn't want to risk it as the prices were very high. However to their credit they provided a very classy and useful umbrella in the room for our use during our stay! Check in and check out was very efficient but then I would not expect less. This could be a beautiful hotel due to its position, but unfortunately I feel they are cashing in on this to the detriment of thier guests. Venice is a very expensive place and we really didn't mind paying high prices if we got quality which here was unfortunatly lacking. This is definately not up to the standards it professes to hold. Businesslike and certainly not for a romantic trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat...”
Reviews.Author: Jomedic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise as well. My hubby and I stayed two nights, and the couple we traveled with only one. Let me tell you, I wish we'd stayed another night. Our first glitch came when trying to make a reservation for a single night on a weekend in off season. We were told by half a dozen hotels that they don't rent rooms for less then 2 nights! No one could really explain why. In english. So we decided on this hotel because of location and booked two rooms for two nights, and our friends had to eat the difference. We paid 210 euro per night for a standard double and 240 euro for a superior double. The intention was that we would pay and stay in the superior, since we were staying two nights. I asked and canal front rooms were going for 675 euro a night, so we knew there would be no view. When you arrive at the airport, you have several options to get to the hotel...the one with the least effort is to take a water taxi (about 95 euro up to 8 people or 6 people with luggage) because all your luggage will be handled for you and they drop you off into the side door of the hotel...the least expensive with moderate effort is to take the Alilaguna Airport shuttle (for 12 euro pp) which involves rolling your luggage down a long walkway to the dock and putting it on the boat (there's no line, push your way forward or you won't get on), with help then unloading luggage with help at the Alilaguna pier which is about a block and half from the hotel and over a single small bridge. You could also take the Alilaguna to a stop prior to St Marks and switch over to the Vaparetto which would drop off immediately in front of the hotel. This would add the cost of the Vaporetto (suggest getting a card before leaving the airport), the unloading and loading of luggage only partially assisted twice, and unknown amount of walking between piers which are usually within a block of each other. Confused yet? We did the Alilaguna and dragged a block and a half. If you're tired after the red-eye, or in any way disabled, splurge on the water taxi. On arrival, i found that the language/cultural barrier had caused issues already. Apparently a 'double' may mean two separate beds and a single would be one bed, even tho it could fit two. Who knew? Not me! Check that out however, because the rates for single rooms are much cheaper. So, the woman at the front desk changed that and asked which room we would like, and my husband made a joke abut 'the one with the best view'...which I followed very quickly with "the superior". Well, either she didn't hear me or was already over us, because when we were taken to our room, it was TINY.
