But, it was nice, with a marble bathroom, and knowing they use special angles on pictures to make them look larger, I figured it was on par. Now, let me say, the bathroom was amazing. Entirely marble with a deep soaking tub...which i guarantee you will fall asleep in at the end of the day. The decor was lovely. It had a minibar with the normal exhorbitant prices (see pics for exact prices), a safe, robes, a bidet and hairdryer in the bathroom, and a flat screen TV. THE BEDS ARE HARD AS ROCKS THO. And the pillows are little slips of nothing. Also, be sure to GET TWO ROOM KEYS because if one of you is in the bath at night, and the other decides to go out for something, a room key had to be in the wall slot or ALL THE LIGHTS GO OUT and it's so dark you cannot even hope to get out. Ya, that was interesting... The concierge staff was most helpful with handing out maps and suggesting must-sees. When you go out the front door which opens onto the Calle Vallaressa, take a left (away from the water) and the next door will be a bank with an ATM! Very convenient! At the end of the street, after walking by every high-end shop in Venice, is a shop that sells the best Gelato...don't leave without one! Take a right there and you'll see the arch of the back end of St Marks square...less than 100 yards, under those arches and you're there! I highly recommend going before 8 AM when you'll be virtually alone and able to take pictures unempeded by thousands of humans which will fill the place by noon. The hotel is perfectly located to walk to or take a Vaparetto to everything in Venice! DO NOT MISS THE FRARI CHURCH, AND GO INSIDE ST MARKS AND THE DOGES PALACE. You will not regret it!! So, our friends arrived while we on Murano the next day. We took the hotel shuttle over and spent about an hour watching the demo and looking at room after room of amazing glass. In the end we couldn't find anything we wanted, said 'No thanks' and were set free. The great thing is that the glass factory they take you to is down the street where the prices are better. Got glass adorned wine bottle stoppers for 10 euro each, way less then the 22 euros at the Rialto Bridge and St Marks square. Do plan to take the Vaparetto back from Murano. Getting you back to your hotel isn't a priority, even if they told you the boats ran every 30 minutes. It took over an hour for one to finally take us back. And with what we gave the guy in tip, we could have paid for the Vaparetto! Our friends ate lunch in the restaurant waiting for us. They said it was great. It was also 66 euro for two entrees and drinks! However, they raved about their room. Said it was the nicest they'd ever stayed in in Europe! So we went to see it. Well no wonder! It was the superior we had paid for!! It was practically a suite! Still no view, just down the hall from us, but very spacious. We didn't say anything since they paid for two nights, they really should have gotten a great room for 420 euro, ya know? As for the winding corridors, the hotel is several buildings that have been joined together. It is mostly euro-chic decor until you get into the room which has a little venetian touch to it. The pics of the room with the friezes on the ceiling is the upstairs ballroom. Breakfast is indeed a few croissants and muffins with tea or coffee and anything else is extra. If you're used to a full breakfast, you'll pay for it. But, if you can wait and pick things up on the way or be okay with finding a restaurant on the fly, it's so much better anyway. Checkout was a breeze. Bellman came within 5 minutes, but we had told them our checkout time the day before, so no surprise there. We had also requested a water taxi the day before at noon, and it was right on time. It took us directly to the port, not up the grand canal tho, and we never touched our bags. All in all, the hotel was sufficient for our needs, clean, most of the staff (all the male staff really) were friendly and helpful, the location was amazing, and while pricey, i would completely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jilllovescricket
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this delightful hotel for two nights prior to joining a cruise. The hotel is conveniently situated on the Grand Canal, as its name implies, & is the ideal location for sightseeing in the centre of Venice. We were given a room overlooking the central courtyard which was quiet and comfortable. The room was well appointed and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was more than adequate. We chose the continental option and were most satisfied. Dinner was taken in the dining room overlooking the Grand Canal so that we could watch the water traffic as we ate our meal. The food was top class and the service excellent. We both recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a bit like Venice itself...”
Reviews.Author: Mousewife
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is a bit like Venice itself: after checking in at the Grand Canal, our bellhop led us through a maze of streets and then interior corridors, up and down staircases, before reaching our room. While our windows opened onto a dark courtyard and had no view, we knew that going in; we opted not to pay for a view. The room itself was quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was well-appointed, with an enormous and trendy shower. The location was convenient, a short walk to St Mark's and close to restaurants (though I expect that's true of just about every accommodation in Venice). Really, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Beautiful Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UkNewTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Honeymoon and WOW what a place!!! It's in a perfect location just by St. Marks Square and by the Vaporetto stop. Which means you won't be one of these tourists lugging suitcases up and down bridges! The hotel is beautifully decorated and we were surprised by the spacious room we had. Yes, it's a posh hotel, but worth every penny. The attention to detail, the postcards for you to keep, the champagne on arrival (Honeymooners), the turn down service all plays a part in ensuring you have a fab time and we certainly did. However if you wish to eat in the hotel, the prices are quite steep. But just off St. Marks Square there are plenty of restaurants with the same ambience just a lot cheaper! The hotel also organises a private taxi to a Murano glass factory, here you get a demonstration of how they create works of art from glass. It's an excellent experience, but just be warned they do try the hard sell, so either turn up with plenty of cash or be ready to say no!! If we were to visit Venice again, we would be more than happy to stay here once more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: The hotel had been renovated and had none of the charm of the photos advertised. Small room which we had to wait to be made up. Despite the high price tag we had to beg to have breakfast out by the canal in the empty restaurant! Overpriced, over rated. Woudn't stay there again. Only plus was the great location.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MardiGras46
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this Hotel prior to starting a cruise. The Hotel staff was very helpful in outlining a walking route for us to take an see the sights. They gave us an upgrade to a room on the Grand Canal when our room was not ready on time. The location of the Hotel is very near St. Marks and Harry's Bar. The only negative thing was that we had to bring our luggage to the lobby after waiting for the bellman for a much longer time than was promised. Make sure your window is completely closed, the air conditioning will not come on otherwise. We discovered this after our room kept getting warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything!”
Reviews.Author: blueseasdreamer
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel and the location couldn't be more convenient! Water taxis are steps away as is San Marco Square. The room was smaller than what the brochure indicated but very well kept and the bathroom made up for the lack of bedroom space. Staff was helpful and the breakfast was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: jacksonlarango
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best! We went on a tour and stayed in Rome and Florence as well. The Rome hotel was ok and it was functional. The Florence hotel was dump, but this one soared above all in Italy! Wonderful modern lobby with a water side terrace cafe as well as a private water taxi dock. Place to pick up gondolas too. Modern rooms, wonderful bathrooms. The staff was very helpful. The first day our lights wouldn't go on, but we realized that you had to put your hotel card key into a slot. The help arrived within 3 minutes to the call of the front desk. Only hotels with key cards instead of clunky keys. Expensive but A++++++++++ worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: female_wanderer
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Lucked out and had a room overlooking the grand canal; we could have watched the gondoliers out the window all day long. The amenities were very clean and beautifully decorated. Rooms are small but to be expected in Europe. Very comfortable and quiet. Bar/Restaurant are very expensive for us poor americans, so we went somewhere else. But great location, within a minute's walk of the Piazza. Although the staff isn't overly friendly, this is typical of Italians, and they always answered our questions even if not in an overzealous way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MattTLondon
Reviews.Content: Great Location, right on the Grand Canal and very near to San Marco where water buses leave every couple of minutes. 5 min walk from St Marks Square. Next to Harrys Bar. Rooms average size for European City Hotels, typical Venetian decor, bathrooms good. Verrandah overlooking the Grand Canal provides a good setting for breakfast and late evening drinks. Summary: Ideal hotel for City Break and reasonable for 4 star hotel prices in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “They redeemed themselves in the end”
Reviews.Author: bspoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Monaco in February , myself , my wife , our two children and my mother-in-law , and after a rocky start we ended up enjoying the place . The restaurant is just a little too snooty for food that is just ok and the female reception staff are just plain unhelpful on the other hand , the male staff were great as were the concierges , the location is brilliant and the price is reasonable ( for Venice ) No views , we had one of a lane way , but why look out the window when all of San Marco is just outside the front door ? So we can look back at the Monaco and say yes we would go there again but now we know what to expect

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great”
Reviews.Author: M747
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a corporate event. Location is great and lobby and public areas are very nice. Rooms are ok. I suspect I was given a room in an older section of the hotel and the hallway was quite old style compared to the rest of the hotel. My room had a large marble bathrooms and this was very nice, The rest of the rooms was OK, nothing to luxurious. Carpets were stained, and this pulled down the overall expression. Staff at the front desk were somewat rude and when I called to inquire about internet in the room the concierge just hug up so I had to go to the reception and collect a wire to connect to the net. LOcation is great, everything else ok. But Hey its Venice, not like repeat business is their main game.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but watch out”
Reviews.Author: labradorheat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted this hotel. On arrival, we were told of a computer problem and relocated to their sister property some 50 meters away at the Palazzo Selvadego Hotel. We were told the rooms were larger and the amenities at the Monaco & Gran Canal were fully available to us including the continental breakfast. We were very disappointed but, based on the descriptions by hotel employees, we agreed to move. 50 meters is roughly the length of 3 houses plus driveways. The Selvadego is almost 3 times that distance. The lobby smelled and was really small; less than 2.5 meters wide. Access to the hotel is by buzzing the front desk personnel. If nobody is there, you donâ€™t get in. After our 4 bags arrived (our carry-on not included), one case was on the chair (actually a bench), one on a night table and the remaining 2 pieces in front of the wardrobe. The hotel was clean (except for the smell in the lobby). We went back to the main hotel and complained because my wife was very upset by the change. We did not feel this was a 4-star property. The assistant manager agreed to find us a room. Without hesitation, we took it. Our major complaint is that we were asked to move even though they had a room available. About 10 couples who were on a cruise ship with us and booked into the hotel did not have a problem. I believe the whole situation was not necessary. After we moved, we started to enjoy Venice. We lost about 1/2 of the daylight dealing with this. The hotel was very nice, the staff were pleasant enough and the senior concierge was the best. We would recommend the hotel and would stay there again. I will, however, request a guarantee that we be put in the main hotel. Incidentally, when we checked out, the same lady who checked us in was on duty. I told her the rooms were about 20 â€“ 25% smaller in the annex hotel and she told me I was mistaken. I only wish I had taken pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: angeltroll
Reviews.Content: Would def. go back again. I took the advice of some of the people on tripadvisor who'd been to this hotel and they described it perfectly. The prices are a bit steep but then again, it's Venice so everything's expensive anyway. This hotel was smart, clean and tastefully decorated. Staff were professional. Everything from your soap to your bathrobe has the hotel's insignia on it. We had a beautiful view too and it wasn't noisy because it was facing the lagoon, NOT a canal. So if you have extra cash to spend on a hotel, spend it on this one. p.s. booking through the website was straightforward and easy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location....makes it worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dfinnyc
Reviews.Content: pricey place, but vencie is a confusing place even with a map... this place is right on the grand canal .. has it's own water taxi stop and it's own water bus stop (st mark's on the number 1 bus)... i saw people wandering the streets with luggage looking for their hotel ... not fun ,and with a big bag it is tough ..no cars at all and you might have to carry bags up stairs over bidges...this hotel was easy to find .. we took the number one bus from the train ..ride was about 35 mins but it is up the grand canal ... if it is your first trip to venice, the ride is an amazing sight ...cheap, easy and beautiful ..consider it part of the sight seeing .. the hotel is right near st mark's square which is the major sight but avoid this area... too many tourists ...overall, the location could not be better ... the breakfast on the grand canal is amazing ...terrific view.... cooked items are extra but not that crazily priced .. hotel was pretty clean but there was a little mold in the shower... nothing to freak out about ...room is tiny ... very tiny ... the restaurant is awesome ..best dinner we had ... expensive but awesome ..re confirm reservations .. they lost our's but had a seat for us anyway .. other nights we got recomendations from the satff.. food was very good in all places they recomended.. not overly pricey for italy , but not cheap .."paradisio" had the best spaghetti with clams that i have ever had... no iron in the rooms so pack carefully or be wrinkled overall, a nice place in a great location with good knowledble concerige ..it is pricey, but it is venice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pontman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights prior to Lake Garda. The hotel faces the Grand Canal adjacent to St Mark's Square so the location is faultless. The hotel itself is well presented and, for a city centre hotel, has decent amenities and reasonably sized rooms. Breakfast was more than adequate with the bonus of being served on a terrace alongside the canal. The restaurant provided excellent cuisine, albeit at outrageous prices ( a venetian speciality). Bar prices were also OTT but there is a world of choice the moment you step out of the hotel. For the price we paid the hotel lived up to expectations, the location and view from the terrace being the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “We were "Saved" by this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LuAnn
Reviews.Content: We had booked a hotel and gone to see it..and it was awful!..so I came down the "street" and found this hotel..my husband was able to book a room and so instead of staying at the "hotel" we had booked via the internet we were able to stay here. It was a wonderful hotel, with a great "modern room"..normally I am interested in older hotels but the one we booked smelled like 5,000 Italians had died there! So..this was a great deal..more than I would have spent to start with but better than what I had...a wonderful CC breakfast on the canal...and I would say..much better than other locations..you are RIGHT on the canal! LuAnn

Reviews.Title: “Awesome but expensive”
Reviews.Author: bettyx1138
Reviews.Content: Overpriced ($400 USD/night for a basic room) but awesome room with no view. Awesome hotel and overall experience. For that price it had better be. I love that they bring continental breakfast on a tray with good coffee in the morning and the guy who brought it was a cutie. They have turndown service which includes a floor mat. (I don't get the floor mat. Do people care about that?) (In fact, I don't get turndown service - its that a little old-fashioned? Do we really need that?) Bed was comfortable and clean and they have nice thick bathrobes. Room was small but I'm from Manhattan so its not an issue for me. Room had a crappy view, onto a roof in the middle of the hotel. But I had the cheapest room so I didn't ask for a better view. I should have. I only slept in the room though so I didn't really care. Staff was all nice and friendly and helpful except when I checked out it was just like OK you're set. I was expecting more of the usual uber friendliness. I had to leave really early my last morning before the kitchen opened but they arranged to bring me a breakfast with what was available at that time which was fine. The decor of the lobby and hotel in general is fabulous chic Architectural Digest material - current and tasteful. They have a computer in the lobby you can buy time to use to check your email. I didn't ask if they have 'net access in the rooms because I didn't have my computer with me. I stayed there because it was a last minute weekend trip I did solo and I wanted to stay somewhere central and nice and safe (and the Bauer was booked). Next time though, I won't mind staying in the outskirts of Venice. Such an awesome little city. I will definitely go back for longer. I'd stay at the Hotel Monaco again if someone else pays for it. Oh and its next to the streets with the highest high end shops in the city, so part of that $400/night is for location.

Reviews.Title: “Only used the restaurant ...this time!”
Reviews.Author: bickley
Reviews.Content: We were staying at a nearby hotel but we liked the look of the Hotel Monaco and we decided that we would try the restaurant. We were not disappointed. We were greeted politely when we booked a table. The food and service were very good. It was a little expensive but all restaurants in Venice are. It cost significantly less than the comparable restaurant we used the night before and prices in many establishments in Venice seem to have increased a lot compared to our last visit three years ago . We enjoyed our dinner at the Monaco so much that we went back the following evening! On the way out we walked through the hotel lobbey area and it looked nice: we have put the Monaco on a list of possible hotels for when we visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Wonderful place..”
Reviews.Author: Hulllass
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to this hotel as a special birthday treat. I read reviews on tripadviser and was a liitle apprehensive. As it turned out I need not have worried. The hotel itself is beautiful, the staff very helpful and informative. The bar and restaurant are a little expensive, but well worth it, as we had the best meal of our stay there. We were also impressed by the fact we could have breakfast delivered to our room each morning at no extra cost! I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KL03
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Only a few steps to St. Macro. Although not facing the Canal, the room itself is very good. A few disappointments: - No alarm clock. - No slipper. - TV does not have English movie channel (it's available in Roma & Florence hotels). - Breakfast only has tea/coffee, juice, and bread. You have to pay extra for others (e.g. fruit, egg, etc.) Agreed with one of the previous reviewers. DO NOT take the free hotel boat to Murano. I did and it's a mistake. They dropped us off directly in a retail store. Although we were not pressured to buy anything, the store was far away from the main pier and tourist location. It's a waste of time. At departure to airport, hotel will advise you to take the water taxi. However, they did not tell me that I could take the water bus which was only 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Both would arrive at the same place at airport, but the price different was huge (EUR 90 vs 2X). Food is way too expensive in Venice. Fortunately, taste is pretty good. Seafood is a must try. We tried the restaurant at hotel on one night and we went to another restaurant located beside Rialto bridge on another night. Both have fantastic food and service. Venice is beautiful, but not much too see. 2 days are more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Daisydoll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently returned from this hotel and we had a wonderful time. The hotel reception had been recently refurbished and looked very tasteful. The hotel staff were very helpful and gave lots of useful advice. Our room was beautiful and the bathroom... well, very plush! We sampled the hotel bar - it was a little expensive, but worth it. We also sampled the restaurant and had the best meal we have ever eaten! The hotel is also in a fantastic spot for all of the sights and prime location from the water taxi stop of San Marco. All in all, we had a wonderful time in Venice, greatly enhanced by this wonderful hotel experience. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ItalyTravelguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. I was there with my wife in December and I must say - location, location, location. The staff was attentive and very professional. Of course I booked this hotel with my traval agent and not some mega travel site who sell the worst rooms the hotel offers. Spend a little more with a professional agent who knows the hotel and ejoy what the hotel has to offer. I would reccommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “great position - entertaining terrace!”
Reviews.Author: suzienrob
Reviews.Content: Although you would not be bowled over by any warmth and welcome of the reception staff the lobby is pleasant and well decorated with an elegant and modern touch. The rooms are not huge but are well appointed, good bathrooms, comfortable beds etc and really peaceful considering superb location so near to key sites. Breakfast on the terrace is the basic continental basket of calories (you can pay Venice prices for eggs etc if you want them). The terrace is wonderful entertainment value as it is right next to a gondelier station - you can admire their boatmanship and skill as well as laughing at certain tourist natiionalitys that are keener at taking photographs than actually taking in the sights and the experience. We would recommend avoiding the water taxis unless you are very rich - the public boat service and the ferries are great value for money. The nicest day out we had was walking across Venice to catch a ferry to the very preety island of Burano - coloured houses, very cute. Walk away from the main square and you can find a charming trattoria with lovely food and a great waiter with a Scottish accent (gained from his wife). In our opinion 3 nights in Venice is enough to experience the delights, and this hotel is a great base for an enjoyable holiday. Do venture away from the main tourist routes - we had our best meal and some superb wine in a tiny backstreet bar and restaurant - the husband and wife team were not high speed service but the food was worth any wait!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, wonderful restaurant, rude rude reception staff!”
Reviews.Author: Claire1234
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, very expensive but worth it food fantastic, the terrace overlooking the canal was stunning, but the bar was a very odd & uncomfortable and unfortunately the reception staff were very very rude, dismissive, ignored you when you stood right next to them, and yes I was trying to speak italian so I was as polite as possible to them, incredibly pompous, great shame as location and the maitre d in the restuarant was so pleasant - fortunately the location and restaurant compensated

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location !”
Reviews.Author: Fred≥raldbelgium
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel, the lobby is wonderfull (a mix of modern and venitian style). The room was just a little too small but the bathroom is very spacious. we stayed in a lot of 5* hotels but the turn over of the Monaco Grand canal is awesome (PJ under the pillow, bed opened at 8 PM, ...) of course the location is excellent and the vieuw from the terrace on the grand canal during the breakfast is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stueyegg
Reviews.Content: Dont listen to bad reviews about this hotel , we paid 480 euros for 3 nights and thought it was worth every little bit . fantastic location right on the grand canal , 2 minute walk from st marks square , water bus stop right outside , restaurant looking out onto the grand canal , beautiful rooms recently renovated with excellent bathrooms and sky tv . the hotel also chucked a 3 day water bus ticket in with the price which is a necessity to get around venice . ok so the breakfast is only croissants , toast and coffee but its enough to keep you going till dinner time anyway . only bad point we found was the expensive drinks at the hotel bar , we would have loved to have had a drink on the terrace at night but they charge the equivalant of around 6 - 7 pounds for a bottle of lager and around 40 pounds for a bottle of white wine .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Rach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco Grand Canal for 4 nights for our wedding anniversary in early July, and had an amazing stay. The location could not be any better. Getting to the hotel is easy - either by the bus boat from the airport (the boat stop is a 30 second walk from the hotel!) or private boat transfer which takes you directly to the hotel's entrance. You are literally 2 minutes walk to St Mark's Square and about 20 mins stroll to Rialto Bridge. The rooms are small but beautiful with chandeliers hanging from the ceiling and full marble bathrooms. We typically like quite contemporary decor and this hotel manages to mix traditional and modern decor beautifully. The room service was the best I have ever experienced - fresh towels and cleaning is done morning and afternoon / evening - they seem to anticipate / look out for when you leave and swiftly come in and clean. The turn down service on a night is great - there were even little cloths placed by the side of your bed for stepping onto (never seen that before!). Regarding the service - admittedly some of the staff can be a little frosty but generally we found them all very pleasant. I honestly think that the Italians are very blunt and direct and if you appreciate that this is more of a culture difference than a personal issue then you won't have any complaints! You won't get a big fake smile like you would in USA. I saw the earlier review about being ignored at the restaurant - you need to book in advance to get into the restaurant as it is really popular and gets really busy! We booked a day in advance and even then there was only 1 table at 9.30pm available! The food is great, but it has a big price tag to match, but well worth the experience! Dining on the terrace on an evening is so romantic, not to be missed! Breakfast was a basket of croissants, rolls and jams, with tea / coffee & orange juice. If you want something more substantial, omlettes or bacon and eggs is about 8 euros which is not all that much really! Especially since you are in Venice and EVERYTHING in Venice is really expensive! Get used to paying top prices or it will end up annoying you! The reception and conceirge staff were briliant with us during our stay. We also had a complimentary bottle of champagne (hmmm well OK probably local sparkling wine!) delivered to our room on the first night of our stay as they knew it was our anniversary! There's also a Gondola stop outside the hotel which is very handy! We booked online directly with the hotel about 6 months in advance and paid roughly Â£160 for the room per night, including breakfast. Given that this is Venice I think this was very reasonable for an amazing 4* hotel. You will find it hard to beat the price, location and quality of this place. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough - this is saying something as I travel a lot and am really picky, having really high expectations of hotels. I don't usually write these reviews but felt that I had to share my views given some of the moans people have had!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco & Grand Canel”
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. This hotel was in the perfect location- right by St. Mark's Square, right by the water bus stop, right by the gondolas. The hotel itself was very nice. Our room was a little small and didn't have a view, but the bathroom was pretty nice. I found the staff here friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ignored at the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed nearby at the Westin Europa & Regina which was lovely and went to the Hotel Monaco for dinner. Or should I say we tried to go to the Hotel Monaco for dinner. Although there were plenty of tables available, the host, waiters and busy boys all ignored us even with our attempts to get someone's attention for seating for 20 minutes. There is no excuse to be completely ignored and treated as though you don't exist.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgrimm_1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed ther for 4 nights in April. Room was facing Canal and right above the restaurant. Windows were insulated very welll and noise not too bad. Since the boats stop right in front of the hotel, one can hear the noise of the crowds occassionally. Staff is so so. They won't knock your socks off like a 4 seasons staff member, but they are also not too bad. If they ask you to go to Murano with a free boat, DO NOT do it. rather take the standard boats and go there. It's like a time share sale, where they drop you off directly in a retail store with over priced merchandise. You are pressured to buy something and it takes away from the experience. Go there on your own and buy same glass ware for 1/3rd of the price. Food is expoensive anywhere, CHECK EVERY BILL in Venice. They will rip you off wherever possible. We also took a cooking class and it was awesome. What a great experience to cook in a Venetian home with great chef's. That was worth every $$ we spent.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco & Grand Hotel for 4 nights. Our third floor corner room was at the very back of the hotel but we could see the top of the Campanile from our room. Some others said they did not like the lobby but we really loved it. It was very upscale and modern. It is very "W" esque. If you have stayed at a "W" hotel and loved it, you will love this lobby. Our room had two twin beds, a desk and chair, two arm chairs and a table and a 15" television. The marble bathroom was beautiful with an accessible shower, heated towel rack, bidet, big white towels and fluffy robes. Room service was perfect. We ordered room service everyday. The eggs and country sausage were always good. The bacon was a little too Italian style for us but it was edible. The food was a little pricey but worth it since we were able to start the day in the room and not have to return until late everyday. The location is great with a water bus stop right out front. It is only a "block" from St. Mark's square and is within walking distance to excellent shopping, museums and more. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I am in a wheelchair and they would rush out to help whenever they saw us coming. We had dinner at the onsite restaurant our last night. It was over priced for what you received. Actually, we paid the same here for some soup and risotto as we did for filet of beef prepared tableside at another local upscale restaurant. I would not eat here again. There are many places to choose from in Venice that are a better value. We loved this hotel and will stay here the next time we visit. We have recommended it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view from our room, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Monaco & Grand Hotel for 6 nights. Our first floor room faced the Lagoon, with a fantastic view of Isola San Giorgio, the Customs House, and Santa Maria della Salute. The San Marco vaporetto station was just beneath our window. Fortunately, the double glazing really did its job, and there was not a lot of noise, even though it was a major pick-up area for organized gondala rides and water taxis. Our room had two twin beds (pushed together, but not made up as a king) a desk and chair, a small settee and coffee table, and a sort of a room divider with a small flat-screen TV monitor on it. There was plenty of closet and drawer space, with real hangers, instead of the theft-proof kind. The marble bathroom was very nice, with double sinks, a huge tub and shower, heated towel rack, bidet, and lots of wonderful fluffy towels. Room service was amazing. We called for our coffee first thing every morning, and it came within five minutes. Turn-down service was lovely, and it was wonderful to come back at the end of the day to a beautifully made-up room. The location could not have been better: a short walk to St. Mark's, a vaporetto stop just outside the door, walking distance to everything, with all the shopping and places to eat you could ever want. So what was the problem? Why the "but . . ."? The complimentary continental breakfast consists of the following: a basket containing (for two guests) two croissants, two rolls, two small muffins, two pieces of zweiback in cellophane, a pot of coffee, tea or chocolate and choice of juice. There is no buffet, and everything else . . . anything else . . . is a la carte and very expensive. We only ate in the breakfast room once. I suppose it might be very pleasant in warm weather to have breakfast out on the terrace, but that was not an option -- and on one sunny (but cool) day, I heard some guests complaining that there was no one serving breakfast outside. The lobby is cold and impersonal. There is no "wow factor," and there is no charm whatsoever. The staff at the front desk is less than warm. We were there for a week, but never greeted by name -- not once. We had to tell them our room number every time to get the key. The bar is awful. It looks like a bus station, with functional modern furniture, terrible lighting, and poor service. The price of the drinks is beyond belief. In all fairness, we were very comfortable at the Monaco, but we will not return. There are too many other hotels in Venice with a better ambience, with more charm, and that make us feel more welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We could'nt have been more satisfied with this hotel. It was gorgeous, clean and friendly. Location was within easy walking to many beautiful spots. Complimentary water taxi to Murano island was a very nice perk...the jewelry is exquisite. The staff at this hotel makes you feel special. We booked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor - thanks for making our trip memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HobokenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: The Monaco's location is the reason to go (on the Grand Canal and right next to Harry's Bar). The Ritz-like service is the reason to go back! We were part of a small wedding there and had a wonderful stay. Rooms (we saw three) ranged from simple to gorgeous with full views of the Grand Canal. Service was great -- and we were high-maintenance! For example, when asked how to get tickets for the train to Milan, the desk helped us pick the right train, sent someone to get the tickets, fronting the money until we picked them up. The terrace bar and restaurant overlooking the canal was like a movie setting. Not cheap but that's all of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: curlysue
Reviews.Content: We are a mid thirties couple who like to stay in quality modern hotels and expect service and amenities that we pay for. We did not get this here. The location of this hotel is excellent and on appearence it is modern and beautiful and has excellent views from the terrace at the front of hotel, and only a minute to walk to St Marks Square. However, staff on the front desk were rude and miserable. Rooms were very very small. Our view was of the middle block of the hotel so just dark alley and the windows of hotel rooms across the way. I booked a double but got two single beds pushed together. Only one pillow each. I dont watch much tv but it was an old portable little one with no English channels. Bathroom was very good, although when I asked if we could have the heating on because we were cold and wet from a rainy day, we were told no, as this was a Venice law stopping the hotel turning heating on pre 15th Oct? The breakfast was a disapointment, it was included in the room rate but this is only tea or coffee and a small basket of bread and jams. Everything else was extra and very expensive. So over all, if I went back, I'd stay in an area away from San Marco as this is an incredibly overpriced area and as Venice is so small you can walk to this area anyway, and afterall walking all over is pretty much all you do in Venice. I wouldnt stay here again unless I'd money to burn and I didnt care about the bills, I've stayed in better 3* hotels with better amenities and larger rooms. I paid Â£250 a night here, but I think that's Venice all over.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor reservations paid 3 months in advance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent weeks researching hotels for our 40th wedding anniversary to Italy. We decided on the Hotel Monaco on Grand Canal at $500 per night, for its location and restaurant. Upon our arrival after a long arduous trip, we were rudely and abrupyly told there was no room for us. We were ushered to a different hotel blocks away, a dingy and dreary place not of our choice.. After my wife's many tears of disappointment, we decided we were at their mercy and had no other choice but to stay at the hotel of the Monaco's staff choice. So much for paying insurance, all waivers favor the hotel and Expedia not the customer. This hotel is unreliable. I booked a hotel in Sorrento independently, everything about it was magnificent, it made the rest of our trip a pleasurable memory. Tip: Consider spending your vacation and money in Rome and along the Amalfi Cost Region

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monaco and Grand Canal Hotel is in a fabulous location right on the Grand Canal and a mere stone's throw from San Marco. It is an expensive hotel but Venice is an expensive city! Breakfast on the terrace was delightful and the staff were very professional. Only a very small number of rooms have a view of the canal but all in all it was an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: caleb17
Reviews.Content: Anyone who hasn't been to Venice can't complain about their stay. The whole trip will be a fairy tale. The Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal was more than I expected. We stayed there for a week. The people that worked there are unbelievable. Friendly and helpful is all that you need to know. The location is supurb. Right on the canal, one minute from San Marco Square and next door to Harry's Bar. It is alittle expensive but remember you are going to Venice, Italy. It's a vacation of a lifetime. Live it up! Live everyday like there isn't a tomorrow and you won't care about the silly price! Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: travellinallie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern, kept up and in a fabulous location. Minutes away from San Marco and the watter shuttle from the airport. The hotel front desk staff was surly and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rnbm
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Our room was clean and a good size. The hotel was quite modern and in a good location. The only draw back was the expense of the water taxis. This is a high end area where things are a little pricy. All the shops near by are high end, Louie Vuitton, Prada Gucci. The maid service was great. They turn down our beds each night and were very friendly. I dont have anything to complain about, about this hotel. Its a nice hotel but really we didnt spend much time in the hotel as we were in such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible waiters ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Go out to the front of the hotel to the canal restaurant, and you are guarrantee to be "welcomed" by the most obnoxious, care-free waiters in all of Europe. Their level of snootiness easily surpasses anything you can find in Paris, Monaco, etc. We stayed here for 3 nights, and spent several afternoons and evenings out on the front deck restaurant, and were repeatedly horrified to see how the staff here treat clientelle. They seem to be trained to provide this type of high-brow, "how-dare-you-sit-or-eat-here" service. The rest of the hotel is OK, and front desk and concierge service is adequate (not cheery or pleasant, but adequate), rooms are very small, and one single glare from down the nose of one of these waiters is enough to make you want to go elsewhere. Which is exactly what I will do next time I come to Venice. BTW, we ate at 2 other canal front hotel/restaurants, and were pleased to find very courteous staff. So the lack of manners seem to be concentrated amongst the waiters here at the Monaco Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic, highly recomend it!”
Reviews.Author: CheekyJas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 24th July. I emailed the hotel to advise it was our anniversary on booking and they delivered a complimentary bottle of bubbly to our room on arrival which I thought was a lovely touch. The location is great, not far to travel off the bus with your cases when you arrive. Only minutes walk to St Marks Square and other attractions. We had one of our evening meals at the hotel and the atmosphere was great very relaxing, sipping wine and just watching the boats and people in their gondolas. If you get a chance make sure you have a gondola ride bit expensive but hey you cant go to venice without the experience. The staff were friendly and we had a small problem with the shower tap, once reported to the desk it was repaired immediately. In all the hotel made our trip to Venice so special. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 3 day stay in this wonderful hotel, nothing was too much trouble for the staff the food in the restaurant is to die for we have eaten in some very expensive places but this was truley great food, 2 of our girls are vegetarian and there were no main courses available so we asked about this when we booked, they said it was no problem and the next evening as we were seated our waiter enquired which people requiered the vegetarian options then discussed their likes and dislikes before comming up with several choices, perfect service! the view from the tables cannot be beaten & I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Just the best!!”
Reviews.Author: angelauk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - arrive by private water taxi up to the Hotel private landing stage from the airport - very expensive but worth it ...the slow public boat took about 1.5 hrs.Private taxi (almost a speed boat ) took approx 20 mins and you feel like royalty!! (80 euros each way) Bathroom the best I have ever seen anywhere in the world with a HUGE mable bath and sink and 2 showers. Breakfast simple but tasty out on the best terrace you could wish for. Staff wonderful and very helpful. Location cannot be beaten.The Gritti Palace appeared musty and ancient in comparison. Any questions just ask!!

Reviews.Title: “You'll Like this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for only one night but everything was perfect. Rooms, beds and bathroom were great. Staff very accomodating and friendly. Had a guide for our day in Venice and she recommended the Cipprioni for dinner or the Monaco. Couldn't get into the Cip so we ate at the Monaco. Absolutely fabulous. Full moon came up over the water and since it was high tide also, the water came up over the deck and made for an exciting evening. We did have the table closest to the water and it really only affected 1 or 2 tables. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rebabee
Reviews.Content: Best hotel on our trip. All hotels we reserved were "supposed to be" 4 or 5 stars. This hotel was great quality and super location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CMK12
Reviews.Content: The Monaco & Grand Canal Hotel is simply the Best hotel in Venice. I spent 8 nights in late May 2005. Best location and best view at breakfast (included with room) of any hotel. Gorgeous room + bathroom. Wonderful staff. And a great amenity -- they changed U.S. dollars to euros without service charge to guests. Please note -- don't change dollars to euros when you arrive at the airport in Italy -- there's a 9-13% "service charge." Change some dollars to euros before you leave the U.S. Venice lovers also note: the vaporetto service stages a 1-day strike about once every three weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzyqFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights the end of May and we could not have been more thrilled with this hotel. First of all, the location is excellent. The rooms are very nice, although our friends got a room the same time we did and theirs was a little nicer than ours, but ours had the better view so we couldn't complain. We got the standard, non-canal view room, but our room looked out onto the street that enters St. Mark's Square so we were able to people watch. Our friends paid the same we did but their room had the view of the building that others complained about. However, they also had a huge tub while our room only had a shower. After having stayed in a lot of very noisy hotels in Europe, I was also pleased that this hotel was relatively quiet. Even in our room by the square, as long as we ran the air conditioning we could not hear outdoor noise. The breakfast that's included in the price was the typical continental fare, but it comes with the best cappucino you have ever had, and my husband and I usually paid a little extra for some eggs or fruit. I did a lot of research on hotels in Venice before booking this one and I feel like my research paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated but nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Backdoc1
Reviews.Content: I am a NYC physician, and I went with my 2 children. We were originally going with my wife, but she could not make it at the last minute due to her pregnancy. To start with: It is impossible to get a Canal View room by booking on-line, no matter if discounted or paying full price. There is obviously a typical Euoropean "hidden inside track" that you need to follow to get one. No manner of offer of upgrade, increased payment, or bribe would allow us to get one once there or prior to arriving. Also, as with many places in Europe, they loath the idea of 3 people in a room, children or not, even if you pay more or offer to upgrade to a suite. We ended up paying 575 E, ($750.00) for a small suite that faced a brick wall. The staff was polite but cold and had a slight 'tude. towards Americans, especially with children. And this is with a well-traveled first-class bunch, not a screaming hoard with Mickey Mouse hats, either. The room was very nice, but the sheets hard and the minibar antiquated. I must say that the room service and maids were on the ball. All in all, we were a bit disappointed. I went there specifically to get a canal view room and save a dollar or 2. Turns out I just should have booked the Gritti Palace for a mere $300.00 more.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: jackieh8
Reviews.Content: I was not an Expedia customer, paid around $500 US for a room that did not have a canal view, BUT I was not disappointed. The room was very nice, the staff tremendously helpful with dinner reservations. The restaurant they recommended was out of this world. The best meal we had during our three week trip to Europe. One word of caution, no irons in the room, if you need something ironed you have to use their pressing service, which is very expensive (as if paying $500 per night isn't, but somehow that seemed worth it, $40 to iron 4 pieces of clothing did not seem worth it) lesson learned, don't leave the US without a small travel steamer. I did a lot of research on various hotels and the last thing I wanted to do was to wander around the small streets of Venice lost pulling my luggage. This hotel's location can not be beat. You literally are steps away from the San Marco Vaporetta stop. That alone made it worth every penny. If I ever return to Venice this will be my hotel. Oh yeah, getting breakfast delivered to our room was also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss - Venice has much better to offer!”
Reviews.Author: Mia3
Reviews.Content: This place has a truly fantastic and envied location, but lacks any charm whatsoever. The magic of Venice is hinted at....on the terrace for instance with its wondeful view across the canal to the magestic Salute church or inside in the Sala del Teatro Ridotto. Unfortunately we found the staff to be unhelpful and rude! Our room (we had one of the suites) was nice but nothing exceptional...The food ranged from mediocre ( dinner) to the plain awful (breakfast) which meant we were left underwhelmed by the whole experience..we were not even cheered by a visit to Harry's Bar ( next door) which is so overrated, please don't believe the hype..dinner was terrible and the Bellini's are served in a thimble - believe me we needed a drink! I chose this hotel above the 'grand dames' CIPRIANI et al because of location and the buzz that surrounded its reopening..but I would try some of the new boutique hotels that are opening now. My husband and I really wanted to like this place...we went for a special anniversary..but the beauty and the grandeur of Venice seems to have been sucked out of the place...we expected it to be expensive and it was...but standards were quite poor overall. The best thing we did was to go wine tasting off the beaten track..with a lovely guide that told us more about Venice than any book could...and took us to a great local enoteca that we wouldn't have found otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: EgyptTravelers
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms, service, restauraunt!!! My first time in Italy and I will never forget my stay here. I plan to return very soon and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a treat to go from the train station boat immediately to your canal facing room. The staff was polite, location outstanding, ambience excellent. We stayed there in February for a great price. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “La Serenissima”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary in Venice. We could not have found a more wonderful hotel than Monaco & Grand Canal. We had a junior suite, very quiet, and sophisticated decor, with a grand marble bath. Another advantage of travelling in March.....you are staying in a luxury hotel at discounted prices. The staff was absolutely first class, and both the desk clerk and concierge helped us with dinner reservations, concerts, and water taxis. Clean linen and towels every day. Trust me......we felt like we were on our "honeymoon". If you want comfort, service, and a fabulous location, this hotel is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: LondonJonathan
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews here, the hotel looked good, so I booked a Superior Room on Expedia. The only rooms offered on the hotel's website, and Expedia's, were Standard and Superior. The cost of the superior room was almost double the cost of a standard and I assumed that you'd get a nicer room with a canal view. When I arrived at the hotel, they showed me to a room which was small and had no view. I complained. The porter didn't speak much English and put my on a mobile phone to the receptionist. They showed me a second room. Exactly the same. A third room. Exactly the same. I asked to see a Standard room. Absolutely no difference whatsoever. I said that I wanted a canal view. The receptionist told me that they do not give Canal View rooms to Expedia customers, and that none of the Superior rooms have canal views. Eventually, after about 45 minutes of complaining, they managed to find a Superior room with a canal view (I'm guessing they had just finished building the room as they were adamant they didn't exist before). But, lesson one if you're planning to go here, don't bother with a superior room. Lesson Two is don't bother with breakfast. The "continental breakfast" is a bowl of dried up bread, a couple of muffins and a single croissant with some jam. If you want juice it's 5 Euros for a small glass. An omelette is 8 Euros. Yoghurt is no less than 3 Euros for one of those little tiny pots you get in 6 packs. The General Manager told me that they will be changing to a buffet breakfast in April as a lot of guests had complained that they were being ripped off. A perfect hotel for people who don't want a canal view and don't eat breakfast. But I'm sure you could do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: ABCABCABCABC
Reviews.Content: I can't deny that this hotel has the best location in Venice. Just 15 seconds away from the vaporetto (ferry) stop at San Marco. The rooms were adequete but not 5 star (apparently the hotel is only 4 star). The bathroom was definitely 5 star - marble, very well lit, very big for European standards. The water from the shower was a quite slow and not powerful enough, but not that much of a problem. The staff, however, were not the best I've come across in any of my trips around the world. They seemed quite impatient and it definitely showed on their faces. It seemed like a big chore to ask them for an umbrella when it was raining outside. Asking them to book a restaurant for dinner seemed like a big task for them. They were helpful, but their attitude needs to be improved. However, I got a great internet rate at their website - 110 Euros per night including breakfast - so I'm not really complaining. I'd definitely stay there again despite their attitude problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Chispeee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in September 04. The location is great, near the heart of the city, obviously you arrive from the airport on a water taxi- there's no other way! Rooms average size, pleasing bathrooms and the best thing of all, the breakfast view from the ground level restaurant overlooking the Grand Canal. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a first timer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a trip around Italy and France. We also got engaged in Venice so this city will always be special to us. This hotel was exceptional due to the staff and location. We stayed in a junior suite so it was pretty roomy for a European hotel room. The staff was friendly and helpful. They even warned us of the over charge on the private water taxi since it waited a few minutes for us. You cannot beat the location! Next to the shops and St. Mark's Square. All transportion right in front as well. I would definitely recommend it to visitors going to Venice for the first time since it seems like the old timers are unhappy with the renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: hotel-snob-london
Reviews.Content: At the end of a trip to Italy, it was a pleasure to stay in this old hotel which has been refurbished in a modern style. The lobby area really is cool with glass ceiling The room we were in at the back of the hotel was quite cosy but we didn't mind as it was really nice. The location couldn't be better. Enjoy

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Monaco & Grand Canal
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1332, 30124 Venice, Italy
